ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I gained knowledge on how to read and present a scientific paper as well as topics relevant to society as a whole. I also learned how to write a literature review.
Literally so much regarding scientific research.

Learned about multiple topics relating biology to societal issues (healthcare in Lebanon, diversity in clinical trials, biology of abortion, etc) and multiple topics in biology through paper discussions. I also gained skills in presenting a science paper, leading discussions, writing a literature review, and writing a grant proposal.
I learned how to present and summarize research to fellow biology students.

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I love how self-driven this class is. The Professor trusts the students, and everyone cares enough about the course and material to get the work done without much monitoring by the Professor. Discussions were engaging and very encouraging/ uncompetitive. That said, some feedback throughout the semester would have been helpful not necessarily more grades, but even a written/ verbal evaluation of our work and contributions to the class.

Professor Horsely is very encouraging and the TA was very attentive. It is a smaller sized class which allowed for more participation and familiarity with each other and the material. It was great to be able to choose the material we presented on and researched so we could learn about a variety of topics.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: It was as good as can be for Covid adjustments

We appreciated how Dr. Horsely was so accommodating to our possible situations and that we all have a variety of issues happening. It succeeded in engaging each other since it was an upper level elective.

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Absolutely! This was an insightful course led by a compassionate, helpful instructor.

Yes! This is the ideal class for MCDB students who are self-motivated and have their own interests that theyd like to pursue further by leading discussions and writing literature reviews/ grant proposals on any topic of their choosing. Discussions were engaging and very encouraging & collaborative rather than competitive. I also appreciated the added focus on social issues related to biology and hope that more courses in the MCDB department address these in the future.

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
